titles.title: Indian Federal Recognition Administrative Procedures Act of 1994
A bill to transfer administrative consideration of applications for Federal recognition of an Indian tribe to an independent commission, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1466-1467, S1470-1471)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 2/10/1994--Introduced. Indian Federal Recognition Administrative Procedures Act of 1994 - Establishes the Commission on Indian Recognition, which shall determine tribal recognition petitions. Requires the Secretary of the Interior to publish an annual list of recognized Indian tribes. Authorizes appropriations for the Commission and the Administration for Native Americans of the Department of Health and Human Services.
